content:
I am a PhD student in Management Science at the University of Texas at Dallas. My advisors are Milind Dawande and Ganesh Janakiraman.
My broad interests are in understanding emerging business models. I am also interested in retail operations and pricing and revenue management.
My academic training/coursework are in the areas of Optimization, Game Theory and Information Economics, Statistics, Econometrics and Machine Learning.

title: Harish Guda

summary: We analyze the key property of interventions that make them beneficial to one or all members in an interaction.
title: Seemingly-Beneficial Interventions

content:
I have always wanted to build attractive websites and still have a lot of control on the various facets of the website. I had previously owned a Google Site, which I never liked. I am not a professional with regards to web-development. Besides, my needs were minimal. With little knowledge on this topic, I did what everyone else does – dive straight into it.
I am quite comfortable with R, and when Yihui Xie and co-authors came out with the book on blogdown, I decided to try it. However, it can be still quite difficult with no experience to HTML, or prior exposure to CSS. Some useful tutorials from Alison Hill (who is a co-author on the textbook) and Chi Zhang eased my way into this beautiful package called blogdown.
I had owned a custom domain (bought from Google Domains), and continued as the tutorials suggested. I hope it works for you if you plan to use it too.
summary:
I have always wanted to build attractive websites and still have a lot of control on the various facets of the website. I had previously owned a Google Site, which I never liked. I am not a professional with regards to web-development. Besides, my needs were minimal. With little knowledge on this topic, I did what everyone else does – dive straight into it.
I am quite comfortable with R, and when Yihui Xie and co-authors came out with the book on blogdown, I decided to try it.
title: Some Information on Creating Websites with R

content:
Hello all!
This is my first post on my new website/blog, thus the title Om Vighnaraja (instead of a Hello World). My hope is to keep y’all updated with content regularly.
Thank you.

title: Om Vighnaraja

summary: We study how an on-demand service platform can coordinate its workforce through forecast-sharing, worker bonuses and surge pricing in a geographically dispersed marketplace using gig-economy workers.
title: Your Uber Is Arriving: Managing On-Demand Workers Through Surge Pricing, Forecast Communication, and Worker Incentives

summary: We study the role of guaranteed support prices in agriculture under supply yield uncertainty and demand-side budget constraints.
title: An Economic Analysis of Agricultural Support Prices in Developing Economies

summary: We study a variant of the classical appointment scheduling problem, where idling is not allowed, but advancing a patient's surgery is allowed. We show that the Shortest-Variance-First (SVF) rule is optimal for our variant.
title: Optimal Policy for a Stochastic Scheduling Problem with Applications to Surgical Scheduling
